Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from three fragments) of North Ionian pottery rosette bowl with handle root; glaze fired light orange; interior glazed, with inscription incised on floor; exterior: handle root glazed; to its right a set of eight vertical tongues flanking a large dot rosette; below, two thick bands.
Curator's comments: The same registration number is used in error for one of the three mended fragments of an inscribed lotus bowl from the Temple of Apollo in Naucratis (see GR 1886,0401.795).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 325)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.832)
